member.name: T:CFX.Command.DeviceInformationRequest
member.summary: Asks a device (participant in a CFX mesh) to provide basic information about itself.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.DeviceInformationResponse
member.summary: Response to the command.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.InformationServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains commands related to interaction with higher level level information systems running in the factory, such as ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) or MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems).

member.name: T:CFX.Command.InformationServices.ValidateUnitRequest
member.summary: Allows a device to validate with a factory-level system (such as an MES system) that a particular production unit is able to be processed at a particular work center. This will typically includes a variety of validations, such as route validation (ensuring that a unit has completed all necessary steps prior to this operation), unit status validation (ensuring that a unit is not in a failed condition, or contains open defects), etc.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.InformationServices.ValidateUnitResponse
member.summary: Reponse to the command.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.MaterialServices.MaterialTransport.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains commands related to picking materials from stock areas, and transporting those materials to particular destinations within the factory environment.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.MaterialServices.MaterialTransport.RetrieveMaterialsRequest
member.summary: Instructs a device (typically an automated stock / material storage and retrieval system) to retrieve a list of materials in the course of generating a material kit that will subsequently be delivered to a particular destination within the factory.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.MaterialServices.MaterialTransport.RetrieveMaterialsResponse
member.summary: Response to the command.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains synchronous commands that must be implemented by all participants in a CFX Mesh.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.UnitIdentificationServices.GetLastUnitIdentifierRequest
member.summary: Requests the most recently acquired production unit identifier from a device. This allows a device or automated work center that does not have its own internal barcode or RFID reader to acquire unit identifiers from external devices (conveyor mounted scanning device, for example) prior to commencing work on a production unit (thereby allowing the work center to generate its own messages containing real unit identifiers during processing).

member.name: T:CFX.Command.UnitIdentificationServices.GetLastUnitIdentifierResponse
member.summary: Response to the command.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.UnitIdentificationServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains commands related to interaction with devices capable of resing and acquiring the unique identifier of production units in a factory (barcode readers, RFID readers, and other devices).

member.name: T:CFX.Command.WorkCenterServices.LockProcessingRequest
member.summary: Instructs a work center to halt production. This might occur for a variety of reasons, such as an out of control process condition, an invalid material setup was detected, etc.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.WorkCenterServices.LockProcessingResponse
member.summary: Response to the command.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.WorkCenterServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains commands related to interaction with all work centers participating in a CFX mesh, regardless of their particular function. A work center is any location in the factory where production work is performed (via humans or via automation).

member.name: T:CFX.Command.WorkCenterServices.UnlockProcessingRequest
member.summary: Instructs a work center that a previously issued has been lifted, and production may resume at the work center.

member.name: T:CFX.Command.WorkCenterServices.UnlockProcessingResponse
member.summary: Response to the command.

member.name: T:CFX.Heartbeat
member.summary: A CFX message that is transmitted periodically by all endpoints participating in a CFX mesh. The message is used to signal to the CFX mesh that the endpoint is online ane running.

member.name: P:CFX.Heartbeat.ExpectedInterval
member.summary: The amount of time that is expected to ellapse between messages for this endpoint.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.InformationServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages related to interaction with higher level level information systems running in the factory, such as ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) or MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems).

member.name: T:CFX.Events.InformationServices.WorkOrderCreated
member.summary: Generated when a new Work Order has been created within the factory environment (typically by the company's ERP system).

member.name: T:CFX.Events.InformationServices.WorkOrderUpdated
member.summary: An existing Work Order has been modified within the factory environment.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.InformationServices.QualityServices.CorrectiveActionProcessInitiated
member.summary: Indicates that a new Corrective Action Process (CAPA) has been initiated.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.InformationServices.QualityServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages related performing quality related business processes within the factory environment, such as CAPA (Corrective Action, Preventative Action), FRACAS (Failure Reporting and Corrective Action), and MRB functions (Material Review Board).

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.MaterialManagement.MaterialCreated
member.summary: A new material handling unit (container or instance of material) has been introduced into the inventory of the factory.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.MaterialManagement.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages related to managing and controlling the inventory of raw materials within the factory.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.MaterialMeasurement.MaterialMeasured
member.summary: One or more measurements have been made against a particular material handling unit (container of material).

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.MaterialMeasurement.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages related to measuring the attributes of raw materials within a factory. For example, an X-Ray electronic component counter might implement this namespace to provide messages related to the quantity of materials remaining in a particular material instance (container). Another example would be an automated material inspection device that is measuring the physical dimensions of materials during an IQC (Incoming Quality Control) operation.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.MaterialStorage.MaterialMoved
member.summary: A material handling unit (container of material) has been relocated to a new stock location within the factory.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.MaterialStorage.MaterialRemoved
member.summary: A material handling unit (container of material) has been removed from a stock location within the factory.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.MaterialStorage.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages related to the storage of materials within the factory. For example, an automated (robotic) material storage and retrieval system might implement the messages of this namespace.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.MaterialTransport.MaterialPickDirective
member.summary: A directive has been issued to pick a list of materials from a particular stock area, and transport those materials to a particular destination within the factory.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.MaterialTransport.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages related to picking and transportation of material kits (groupings of materials) to various destinations within the factory environment.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.MaterialServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages related to the flow of materials within the factory environment.

summary.para: Root CFX message topic. All endpoints participating in a CFX network must produce and process the messages contained within the root topic.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.UnitIdentificationServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages related to the identification of production units for tracking and traceability purposes throughout the factory. It is indended for implementation by devices capable of reading the barcodes/RFID's/other of production units to acquire their unique identification.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.UnitIdentificationServices.UnitIdentifierRead
member.summary: Indicates that the unique identifier of a production unit has been read by an identification capture device (barcode reader, RFID reader, etc.).

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.EnvironmentalProcessing.EnvironmentSampled
member.summary: An environmental condition within the workcenter was measured (such as a temperature or humidity reading).

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.EnvironmentalProcessing.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages related to the environmental processing of production units, such as temperature stress tests, humidity chamber processing, bake processes, etc.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.EnvironmentalProcessing.UnitsEnvironmentallyProcessed
member.summary: Indicates that one or more production units have undergone and completed environmental processing at a particular work center.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.MaterialTraceability.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages that describe the raw materials and parts that were incorporated into production units processed at a work center.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.MaterialUsage.MaterialsConsumed
member.summary: This message is generated when a work center consumes raw material.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.MaterialUsage.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages that describe the raw materials and parts were consumed at a work center in the course of its processing. The materials that are consumed may or may not have been incorporated into production units processed at the work center.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.MaterialUsage.ToolingUsed
member.summary: This message is generated whenever a work center uses a piece of tooling in the course of its operation.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages that are produced by any location in the factory where production work is perfomed. This includes but is not limited to, all automated process machines and equipment in a factory that perform a production related function, regardless of its individual capabilities or specific function. Also included are unautomated workcenters, where human operators perform production functions.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.PackAndShip.ItemPacked
member.summary: Indicates that an item was placed into packaging or a shipping container.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.PackAndShip.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages that describe the packing of production units and other materials into product packaging and/or containers for shipment.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.SMTPlacement.ComponentMisPick
member.summary: An attempt to pick a component from its feeding device was not successful.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.SMTPlacement.ComponentRecognitionError
member.summary: Indicates that an error was encountered by the vision and/or component centering system after the component was picked, and installation of the component aborted.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.SMTPlacement.ComponentsInstalled
member.summary: Indicates that one or more electronic components were installed on to a particular production unit.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.SMTPlacement.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages specific to work centers involved in the placement of SMT components on to printed circuit boards, known as automated pick and place equipment.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.SMTReflow.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages specific to work centers involved in the reflow of SMT components on printed circuit boards, known as reflow ovens.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.SMTReflow.ZoneConditionSampled
member.summary: An environmental condition within a particular zone of a reflow oven has been sampled and measured, such as a temperature, humidity, oxygen content, etc.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.SMTSolderPasteDispensing.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages specific to work centers involved in the printing or dispensing of solder paste on printed circuit boards, known as stencil printers and solder paste jet dispensers.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.SMTSolderPasteDispensing.SolderPasteDispensed
member.summary: Indicates that solder paste has been dispensed on to the surface of one or more production units.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.SMTSolderPasteDispensing.StencilCleaned
member.summary: Indicates that the stencil printer has performed an automated stencil cleaning operation on the currently mounted/active stencil.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.TestAndMeasurement.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages specific to work centers involved in the testing and inspection of production units. This include human inspection stations, AOI Equipment (Automated Optical Inspection), In-Circuit Test Equipment, Functional Test Equipment, etc.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.TestAndMeasurement.UnitsInspected
member.summary: Indicates that one or more production units were inspected at a workcenter.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.TestAndMeasurement.UnitsTested
member.summary: Indicates that one or more production units were tested on some manner (functional testing, electrical testing, etc.) at a work center.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.THTInsertion.ComponentInserted
member.summary: Indicates that a through-hole electronic component was inserted and installed on to a printed circuit board (PCB).

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.THTInsertion.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages specific to work centers that insert through-hole technology electronic components (THT) on to printed circuit boards (PCB's). This includes automated axial, radial, and DIP insertion equipment, as well as semi-automated (human guided) equipment.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.THTSoldering.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains messages specific to work centers involved in the soldering of through-hole technology (THT) electronic components on to printed circuit boards (PCB's). This includes wave solder machines, as well as selective soldering equipment.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterServices.THTSoldering.ZoneConditionSampled
member.summary: An environmental condition within a particular zone of a wave solder machine has been sampled and measured, such as a temperature, humidity, oxygen content, etc.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.WorkCenterStateChange
member.summary: Indicates that the current state of a production station has changed (based on the CFX equipment state model).

member.name: P:CFX.Events.WorkCenterStateChange.NewState
member.summary: The new state of the production station.

member.name: T:CFX.Events.StationState
member.summary: An enumeration indication the current state of a production station.

member.name: F:CFX.Events.StationState.Unknown
member.summary: The state of the station is unknown

member.name: F:CFX.Events.StationState.Setup
member.summary: The station is being setup, and is not in production.

member.name: F:CFX.Events.StationState.IdleStarved
member.summary: The station is in production, but is idle because there are no production units available for processing.

member.name: F:CFX.Events.StationState.IdleBlocked
member.summary: The station is in production, but is idle because the station is blocked by a downstream condition, and cannot move production units downstream.

member.name: F:CFX.Events.StationState.Executing
member.summary: The station is in production, and actively proecessing a production unit.

member.name: F:CFX.Events.StationState.Down
member.summary: The station is in production, but has been halted by an error condition or fault.

member.name: T:CFX.CFXEnvelope
member.summary: The class is the outer envelope or container in which all CFX messages are enclosed for transmission. Common properties, such as a globally unique identifier (ID) and the timestamp for the message (TimeStamp), are defined by this container class and are included with all CFX message transmissions.

member.name: P:CFX.CFXEnvelope.MessageID
member.summary: An identifier (128-bit GUID) that uniquely identifies this particular message instance.

member.name: P:CFX.CFXEnvelope.RequestID
member.summary: For envelopes involved in asynchronous request/response transactions between endpoints, a unique identifier (128-bit GUID) that uniquely identifies the request/response transaction. The endpoint that initiates the "Request" generates this identifier, and endpoints that respond should include this identifier in their "Response".

member.name: P:CFX.CFXEnvelope.MessageName
member.summary: The name of the enclosed CFX message (the type of message)

member.name: P:CFX.CFXEnvelope.MessageVersion
member.summary: The version number of the enclosed CFX message.

member.name: P:CFX.CFXEnvelope.EndpointID
member.summary: A text field representing the CFX Endpoint ID that published this message.

member.name: P:CFX.CFXEnvelope.TimeStamp
member.summary: The date/time when the event associated with this message ocurred.

member.name: P:CFX.CFXEnvelope.MessageBody
member.summary: The message payload (The CFX message enclosed in this envelope).

member.name: T:CFX.WorkCenterServices.MaterialTraceability.MaterialConsumedByUnits
member.summary: Indicates that material has been consumed in the course of processing one or more production units, the material was incorporated into the unit(s), and should be included in the material traceability record of the unit(s).

member.name: T:CFX.UnitCompleted
member.summary: Indicates that work has been completed on one or more production units at a particular work center.

member.name: T:CFX.UnitStarted
member.summary: Indicates that work has begun on one or more production units at a particular work center.
